reviews.review_msg: Engaging, approachable, and passionate. Evan takes extremely technical and at times difficult material and makes it captivating. He also very obviously cares about his students. If you have the chance, you should take a class with him! Great prof, great dude.

In my opinion, the most outstanding lecturer in the PSYC department at SFU. Easily accessible and tirelessly committed to maintaining and improving student experience, even through the most challenging of circumstances like strikes. Tests have clear expectations and helpful study guides that should at least guarantee you a B if you complete them.

One of the best psychology instructor! So caring and approachable. Even though this course is so damn difficult for psyc students, Evan's help made it easier for students to survive. The content is tough, get ready to read. HOWEVER, if you had a different option, I suggest you to never take this class in the first place :)

Evan is extremely knowledgable and is passionate about what he teaches and really cares for his students. Lecture attendance is not mandatory but he does hint what MC questions will be on the exam if you show up. Gives great lectures, and good exam outlines. Excellent prof. Would go out of my way to take another course he teaches.

Let's just say, I would not recommend this class to my worse enemy. It's that bad it was. Too much dense info to know per lecture. Extremely hard marking for online discussion. Midterm average was 60%. I took this course because I genuinely wanted to learn about hormones, but aside from cramming all the info in, I don't think I learned much.

He's ok. Not very inspirational or anything but still does a fine job at explaining things. His slides are good; they cover all the important stuff. Online discussions sucked but if you put in the work you'll get the grades. If you need the course he's a fine prof to take it with, but I wouldn't take the course at all unless you need/want to.

I think the 20% discussion is absolutely ridiculous. It's not my job to make sure the Arts students understand the material. Spending time researching and looking for sources to back up things that I already know is such a waste of time. I would not take his class again.

So much material, but Bryan makes it super interesting. Study well in advance for the exams, I found that flashcards helped greatly. Use slides as study guides! Do the online discussion because it's an easy 20%. Even if your group sucks and doesn't post (or, in my case, they all wait until the last minute), do your part and you will get the marks.

Class required a lot of memorization. Midterm was fair but final was brutal. Study in advance for final. Know specifics of everything especially things involved with maternal behavior . Discussions were 20% of the course and the average was 10/20. Your post has to be extremely scientific and well researched to get  a weekly 7/10. No textbook needed

Bryan is a reply nice person. His lectures were always interesting and funny! But that being said if you don't have a big bio background the concepts can be difficult! Nothing to do with Bryan just the nature of the course.

I recommend taking the intersession course as you will remember the material better for exams. Overall, Bryan is a laid back professor. Study his slides! They will serve as a guide for what to study in the book. Read the chapters at least once. Midterm was fair, but final went into specifics. Participate in weekly discussions for the easiest 20%!

My gripe was with the Discussion component of this course. It is worth 20% of the final grade, and the only criteria is to make 3 posts of "new" information per lecture. For our group, this devolved to people copy and pasting links to journal articles which they obviously didn't read. Very little discussion about actual course content was fostered.
No Comments

Dr. Watson is a great professor. He is incredibly caring and really helped me out a lot when I was taking this course. You can tell he really cares about his students. It's not an easy course (quite content-heavy) so if you don't put in the work, you won't do well. But lectures are engaging and he explains difficult concepts clearly

Really interesting lectures, including his tangents, but I wouldn't bother going to lecture since its easier to hear people having dinner beside you than him talking. Didn't really appreciate him taking old flawed lecture recordings when we went online, but at least jokes remained. If you're short on time only read the lecture-relevant textbook pgs
Great prof!! The material is very difficult and the textbook material is extremely dense. I'd advise not missing a lecture because he is a) interesting! and b) he explains the material very clearly.

He's such an excellent professor. I hated endocrinology before attending the class, and it's really not an easy course. It's packed with information...but he makes the material so easy to understand and so fun to study. The best psychology prof I have ever had.
Neil is excellent! He covers the material in the book and while his tests are difficult, they're more than manageable if you study. He's not hard to look at either

Great Prof! He has some great anecdotes and keeps the class engaged. He encourages questions in class and is good at posting notes and recording lectures. One of the best profs that I've had at sfu! Very interesting course too!

I love this guy! I wish I had taken 280 with him! The material is tough and so are the exams, but I think that everything is explained clearly and in an entertaining way. He keeps the class entertained with odd jokes and funny anecdotes, and makes the material even more interesting than it is. Great prof!
No Comments
great

yeah it is challenging, but don't even bother reading the entire text book...the final was not too difficult..all the questions were from his lecture notes and further emphasizes from the textbook..if i knew his test were like this, i wouldnt have wasted my time reading all the chpts and end up with such a crappy mark on my midterm..ehh.

I would have to agree...a very challenging class..yet Neil makes it more interesting...thought he he did a great job teaching the course. study study study.....pretty tough material especially if u're not very familiar with Bio...average for the midterm was 62%

THE most difficult course. Text is unbearable (written by a guy from Johns Hopkins). But the Neil clarifies the material SO WELL and makes it 200 times easier to understand. If u'r not aiming for an A, just study the lecture notes and u'll do fine on exams. Tutorials are HELL, not helpful at all.

Watson's a nice guy, and pretty interesting in lecture (despite the awful material).  However, his class is hard as hell. Don't take it unless you are REALLY interested in the stuff...otherwise you're going to lower your GPA substantially
great class

Neil is great but his TAs are not always as great as he is. His material is challenging but if you really study for the exams you will do well. He doesn't try to trick you. And, I agree, his stories are fun :)
